message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about weathering and its effects on the environment. Weathering refers to the breakdown of rocks and minerals on the Earth's surface over time. This process releases nutrients that can be absorbed by plants like ferns, allowing them to have sustenance. Option (B) is incorrect because lighthouses emitting visible light has nothing to do with weathering. Option (C) is a common saying but unrelated to weathering. Option (D) is also unrelated to weathering as it refers to the hunting behavior of cats.

This question requires knowledge about the process of weathering and its effects on the environment. Weathering refers to the breakdown and wearing away of rocks and other materials due to exposure to the elements. Over time, weathering creates the soil in which plants like ferns can grow and obtain sustenance. Option (B) is unrelated to weathering and refers to the function of a lighthouse. Option (C) is a humorous myth and not related to weathering. Option (D) is unrelated to weathering and refers to the hunting behaviors of cats.
